required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interventional Endoscopy Database for Pancreatico-biliary, Gastrointestinal and Esophageal Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography, Endoscopic Ultrasound and Interventional Endoscopy in Pancreatico-biliary, Gastrointestinal and Esophageal Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: Our institution performs therapeutic ERCP (Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography ), Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS) and Interventional Endoscopy in around 1000 patients a year. Procedures such as biliary and/or pancreatic sphincterotomy, stents placement (metallic or plastic) and removal for revision, cysts and pseudocysts drainage are conducted in patients suffering from pancreatico-biliary disorders, gastrointestinal disorders and esophageal disorders. The investigators would like to assess prospectively the efficacy and safety of these routine procedures to permit identification of technical details about the procedures or other factors which might be associated with outcome or results. Assessment of these details would help us with problem identification and recommendations to improve health outcomes and quality of life in these patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Our institution performs therapeutic ERCP (Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography ), Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS) and Interventional Endoscopy in around 1000 patients a year. Procedures such as biliary and/or pancreatic sphincterotomy, stents placement (metallic or plastic) and removal for revision, cysts and pseudocysts drainage are conducted in patients suffering from pancreatico-biliary disorders, gastrointestinal disorders and esophageal disorders. The investigators would like to assess prospectively the efficacy and safety of these routine procedures to permit identification of technical details about the procedures or other factors which might be associated with outcome or results. Assessment of these details would help us with problem identification and recommendations to improve health outcomes and quality of life in these patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Establishing a database that contains all Interventional Endoscopies
primary_outcome.description: Collection of procedure specific details of all Interventional Endoscopies

arm_group.description: Any group that went Interventional Endoscopy procedures.

intervention.description: Advanced imaging endoscopic or therapeutic endoscopy

study_pop.textblock: Any subject that underwent Interventional Endoscopy for Pancreatico-biliary, Gastrointestinal or Esophageal disorders.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any subject that underwent Interventional Endoscopy for Pancreatico-biliary, Gastrointestinal or Esophageal disorders.
- Above the age of 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any group that did not undergo Interventional Endoscopy for Pancreatico-biliary, Gastrointestinal or Esophageal disorders.
- Below the age of 18 years

facility.name: Weill Cornell Medical College of Cornell University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University
